snippet: As President Obama takes military action in Syria, Congress is refusing to do what many lawmakers believe is its obligation: Debate the meaning of war and vote on whether to authorize it.
abstract: Congress as a whole continues to avoid initiating vote to authorize war against Islamic State extremist group, despite criticism from Pres Obama and others that they are failing to support troops and neglecting their Constitutional obligations; reasons for reluctance are diverse, with Republicans criticizing Obama's strategy and Democrats wary of repeating their endorsement of Iraq war in 2002.
lead_paragraph: As President Obama takes military action in Syria, Congress is refusing to do what many lawmakers believe is its obligation: Debate the meaning of war and vote on whether to authorize it.

headline.main: A Congress That Doesn’t Want to Weigh In on War
headline.print_headline: A Congress That Doesn’t Want to Weigh In on War
